Title: Get Out
Plot: A young African-American visits his white girlfriend's parents for the weekend where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.
Main Cast: Daniel Kaluuya Allison Williams Bradley Whitford
Rating (RT): 99% Funny scary and thought-provoking Get Out seamlessly weaves its trenchant social critiques into a brilliantly effective and entertaining horror/comedy thrill ride.

Title: Don't Breath
Plot: Hoping to walk away with a massive fortune a trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who isn't as helpless as he seems.
Main Cast: Stephen Lang Jane Levy Dylan Minnette
Rating (RT): 88% Don't Breathe smartly twists its sturdy premise to offer a satisfyingly tense chilling addition to the home invasion genre that's all the more effective for its simplicity.

Title: El orfanato
Plot: A woman brings her family back to her childhood home which used to be an orphanage for handicapped children. Before long her son starts to communicate with an invisible new friend.
Main Cast: Belen Rueda Fernando Cayo Roger Princep
Rating (RT): 87% Deeply unnerving and surprisingly poignant The Orphanage is an atmospheric beautifully crafted haunted house horror film that earns scares with a minimum of blood.

Title: The Babadook
Plot: A widowed mother plagued by the violent death of her husband battles with her son's fear of a monster lurking in the house but soon discovers a sinister presence all around her.
Main Cast: Essie Davis Noah Wiseman Daniel Henshall
Rating (RT): 98% The Babadook relies on real horror rather than cheap jump scares -- and boasts a heartfelt genuinely moving story to boot.

Title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe
Plot: A father and son both coroners are pulled into a complex mystery while attempting to identify the body of a young woman who was apparently harboring dark secrets.
Main Cast: Brian Cox Emile Hirsch Ophelia Lovibond
Rating (RT): 86% The Autopsy of Jane Doe subverts the gruesome expectations triggered by its title to deliver a smart suggestively creepy thriller that bolsters director Andr� Ovredal's growing reputation.

Title: Chernobyl Diaries
Plot: Six tourists hire an extreme tour guide who takes them to the abandoned city Pripyat the former home to the workers of the Chernobyl nuclear reactor. During their exploration they soon discover they are not alone.
Main Cast: Jesse McCartney Jonathan Sadowski Olivia Dudley
Rating (RT): 17% Despite an interesting premise and spooky atmospherics Chernobyl Diaries is mostly short on suspense and originality.

Title: Gone Girl
Plot: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.
Main Cast: Ben Affleck Rosamund Pike Neil Patrick Harris
Rating (RT): 87% Dark intelligent and stylish to a fault Gone Girl plays to director David Fincher's sick strengths while bringing the best out of stars Ben Affleck and Rosamund Pike.

Title: The Girl on the Train
Plot: A divorcee becomes entangled in a missing persons investigation that promises to send shockwaves throughout her life.
Main Cast: Emily Blunt Haley Bennett Rebecca Ferguson
Rating (RT): 45% Emily Blunt's outstanding performance isn't enough to keep The Girl on the Train from sliding sluggishly into exploitative melodrama.

Title: Shutter Island
Plot: In 1954 a U.S. Marshal investigates the disappearance of a murderer who escaped from a hospital for the criminally insane.
Main Cast: Leonardo DiCaprio Emily Mortimer Mark Ruffalo
Rating (RT): 68% It may not rank with Scorsese's best work but Shutter Island's gleefully unapologetic genre thrills represent the director at his most unrestrained.
Nuni Aprooval: This movie made me fall in love with the psychological-thriller genre. My top movie.
PosterFileName: shutter island ver.png/shutter island hor.jpg/shutter island klimt.png/shutter island leo.JPG/shutter island art1.jpg

Title: Black Swan
Plot: A committed dancer wins the lead role in a production of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake" only to find herself struggling to maintain her sanity.
Main Cast: Natalie Portman Mila Kunis Vincent Cassel
Rating (RT): 86% Bracingly intense passionate and wildly melodramatic Black Swan glides on Darren Aronofsky's bold direction -- and a bravura performance from Natalie Portman.

Title: Memento
Plot: A man juggles searching for his wife's murderer and keeping his short-term memory loss from being an obstacle.
Main Cast: Guy Pearce Carrie-Anne Moss Joe Pantoliano
Rating (RT): 92% Christopher Nolan skillfully guides the audience through Memento's fractured narrative seeping his film in existential dread.

Title: The Machinist
Plot: An industrial worker who hasn't slept in a year begins to doubt his own sanity.
Main Cast: Christian Bale Jennifer Leigh Aitana Sanchez-Gijon
Rating (RT): 77% Brad Anderson's dark psychological thriller about a sleepless factory worker is elevated by Christian Bale astonishingly committed performance.

Title: Donnie Darko
Plot: A troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes after he narrowly escapes a bizarre accident.
Main Cast: Jake Gyllenhaal Jena Malone Mary McDonnel
Rating (RT): 86% Richard Kelly's debut feature Donnie Darko is a daring original vision packed with jarring ideas and intelligence and featuring a remarkable performance from Jake Gyllenhaal as the troubled title character.

Title: Fight Club
Plot: An insomniac office worker looking for a way to change his life crosses paths with a devil-may-care soapmaker forming an underground fight club that evolves into something much much more.
Main Cast: Brad Pitt Edward Norton Meat Loaf
Rating (RT): 79% Solid acting amazing direction and elaborate production design make Fight Club a wild ride.

Title: Silence of the Lambs
Plot: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer a madman who skins his victims.
Main Cast: Jodie Foster Anthony Hopkins Lawrence Bonney
Rating (RT): 95% Director Jonathan Demme's smart taut thriller teeters on the edge between psychological study and all-out horror and benefits greatly from stellar performances by Anthony Hopkins and Jodie Foster.

Title: Se7en
Plot: Two detectives a rookie and a veteran hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.
Main Cast: Morgan Freeman Brad Pitt Kevin Spacey
Rating (RT): 80% A brutal relentlessly grimy shocker with taut performances slick gore effects and a haunting finale.

Title: The Usual Suspects
Plot: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat which began when five criminals met at a seemingly random police lineup.
Main Cast: Kevin Spacey Gabriel Byrne Chazz Palminteri
Rating (RT): 89% Expertly shot and edited The Usual Suspects gives the audience a simple plot and then piles on layers of deceit twists and violence before pulling out the rug from underneath.

Title: Enemy
Plot: A man seeks out his exact look-alike after spotting him in a movie.
Main Cast: Jake Gyllenhaal Melanie Laurent Sarah Gadon
Rating (RT): 74% Thanks to a strong performance from Jake Gyllenhaal and smart direction from Denis Villeneuve Enemy hits the mark as a tense uncommonly adventurous thriller.

Title: The Prestige
Plot: After a tragic accident two stage magicians engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion whilst sacrificing everything they have to outwit the other.
Main Cast: Christian Bale Hugh Jackman Scarlett Johansson
Rating (RT): 75% Full of twists and turns The Prestige is a dazzling period piece that never stops challenging the audience.

Title: Secret Window
Plot: A writer is accused of plagiarism by a strange man who then starts haunting him for "justice."
Main Cast: Johnny Depp Maria Bello John Turturro
Rating (RT): 46% Depp is quirkily entertaining but the movie runs out of steam by the end.

Title: Arrival
Plot: A linguist is recruited by the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecrafts land around the world.
Main Cast: Amy Adams Jeremy Renner Forest Whitaker
Rating (RT): 94% Arrival delivers a must-see experience for fans of thinking person's sci-fi that anchors its heady themes with genuinely affecting emotion and a terrific performance from Amy Adams.

Title: Triangle
Plot: A group of friends suffer a yachting accident and take refuge on a cruise drifting on the open sea but quickly realize they were better off on the upturned yacht
Main Cast: Melissa George Joshua McIvor Jack Taylor
Rating (RT): 80% No Consensus.

Title: We need to talk about Kevin
Plot: Kevin's mother struggles to love her strange child despite the increasingly dangerous things he says and does as he grows up. But Kevin is just getting started and his final act will be beyond anything anyone imagined.
Main Cast: Tilda Swinton Ezra Miller John Reilly
Rating (RT): 76% We Need to Talk About Kevin is a masterful blend of drama and horror with fantastic performances across the board (Tilda Swinton especially delivering one of her very best).

Title: Primer
Plot: Four friends/fledgling entrepreneurs knowing that there's something bigger and more innovative than the different error-checking devices they've built wrestle over their new invention.
Main Cast: Shanne Carruth David Sullivan Casey Gooden
Rating (RT): 72% Dense obtuse but stimulating Primer is a film for viewers ready for a cerebral challenge.

Title: Inception
Plot: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a CEO.
Main Cast: Leonardo DiCaprio Joseph Gordon-Levitt Ellen Page
Rating (RT): 86% Smart innovative and thrilling Inception is that rare summer blockbuster that succeeds viscerally as well as intellectually.

Title: The skin I live in
Plot: A brilliant plastic surgeon haunted by past tragedies creates a type of synthetic skin that withstands any kind of damage. His guinea pig: a mysterious and volatile woman who holds the key to his obsession.
Main Cast: Antonio Banderas Elena Anaya Jan Cornet
Rating (RT): 80% The Skin I Live In lacks Almodovar's famously charged romance replaced with a wonderfully bizarre and unpredictable detour into arthouse ick.

Title: The one I love
Plot: A troubled couple vacate to a beautiful getaway but bizarre circumstances further complicate their situation.
Main Cast: Mark Duplass Elisabeth Moss Ted Danson
